page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our block is situated in the part of N.Scot. known as the Black Isle. This is not a true island but is surrounded on three sides by the sea and on the fourth side it is joined by a narrow neck of land.The countryside is fairly flat, rising gradually from the shoreline towards the hill known as Mount High which is the highest part of the Black Isle.It is a farming community consisting of farmhouses and cottages dotted about and a small village, Jemimaville. The land is mainly used for agricultural purposes with some patches of mixed woodland stretching to the Forestry Commission plantations on the summit of Mount High.
